meanings.definition: Wind (something, such as film or tape) onto a new spool.
meanings.sent1: I am respooling the yarn onto a bigger spool.
meanings.sent2: She respooled the thread neatly onto the empty spool.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought respooling the toilet paper was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The magician respooled the ribbon with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic showed me how respooling the wire can prevent tangles.

meanings.sent1: After the tape got tangled, I had to respool it carefully.
meanings.sent2: He respooled the fishing line to fix the knot.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept respooling the same wire over and over for no reason.
meanings.sent4: She respooled the memories in her mind like a movie reel.
meanings.sent5: The gardener respooled the hose to water the plants efficiently.
